8223B746F5C344369B2A6F678EDB2757.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

29414EBFD8D8498CAFED82A575563EF2.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

D1EDAB289A814FEE8B700F455251DDD7.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

02B1FC4E6C7D41FAB9ECF81A0F2D974D.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

C21B2F80EF634DB7824630A7AAB43A19.description: Showcase skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

B6526BB842D949B68F049D3FDA9CC205.description: Relate work placement experience to personal and career goals.

C13A0C348E1A4A28926627BAABF3C575.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement

E1F8458D784A406689E81B19FEAEB930.description: Document personal experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, • skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance employability.

09CF4412B5E540DF872F00B6B526DD4E.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

D1A0776FDDE140A1A33C0A7389D916A0.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

C51B2BAB49704E5FBEB9A7B826873342.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

5BC04F52586E4CD5A68FF445E96A2ABA.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

145755D324014372AFF8F9E80BFD08BC.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

197A3F76E0B74C7C826C2AEA0512675F.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear? , When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance? ,What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

9E0AF1D14A5944A9809FA8DF09CB0152.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

1180E0DC8E3747FE823010758F72308B.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: • transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

82AED1D1081846F29A7206A8BC56EEE6.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

706F5AAEC20148589876357F7972B500.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations

A869E65F9F7841FB838DD64D8FBEAAC0.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

DFD84A4590C7488FBF7630ADA50A13A1.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

F03FD51C29054060BF06880B5681C47B.description: Develop an implementation strategy for improvement of the selected industrial design.

206D6F124512460DB9C120223A22AEFE.description: Adjust the improvement plan to reflect applicable feedback.

97F9109888E54EE2A63866F5E4C10407.description: Solicit feedback and critique on the design improvement plan.

804D8594AEDB4D0FBDF94A4D452DAECE.description: Create a design improvement plan document outlining: the nature of the project or product to be improved; the reasons or need for improvement of the product or project; the design principles and elements to be addressed in the product or project improvement; and, the aspects of the design improvement that will require material cost estimation.

F27A301728964754AB87C17692015441.description: Select an industrial design project of interest to be improved.

2A5FDDAC779D46B499431DECE1A2FB5B.description: Design and plan an implementation strategy for an industrial design improvement.

D284BF9C25D647B7BC286467FFB98BFE.description: Identify and structure a hypothetical design solution by: researching the future of design and applying what is learned to the hypothetical design solution; using new and emerging technology or techniques in the solution; providing analysis and/or research supporting the design solution; and, producing a proposal for the hypothetical solution,

7FD517EB8D544412929813E6E14DD3D3.description: Write a design brief detailing a possible future problem to be solved (e.g., environmental, societal).

F14C45E5EC894FCC89864861872C12E1.description: Propose hypothetical design solutions (e.g., models, drawings, renderings or animations) for a potential future design challenge.

7DB6BF143F974531B156C7E9960D6A56.description: Predict how future roles and challenges are likely to differ from those currently faced by designers.

593EA498FDF2434397A2E0599939BE28.description: Describe the role of designers in the future and some of the potential challenges they will face.

4F389B7851374ABF9CACC3422830FE4D.description: Explore emerging challenges and possibilities in design.

8B9522F0B6584918BAC44DF30BF957A0.description: Research how composites, alloys and synthetic materials are developed to solve a variety of challenges in manufacturing and design.

3196E1ADADA74F25B41398C01E2D5F23.description: Examine how a variety of manufacturing processes affect material choices.

13267BE45D674204B106BA4BBE40C634.description: Demonstrate how various design aesthetics, such as colour, finish and durability influence choice of materials selected for production of an object.

F1D05C5803AE418681D1F3D6825FF1AF.description: Explain how the usage requirements of a finished product influence material selection.

8DE5AEB287D046A6832487DBA81956BC.description: Investigate the availability of various materials to be considered in fabrication of a select finished product.

F88BA9C00C20458EB97FEC97D1A8A112.description: Describe how the selection of materials is influenced by the intended purpose of each of the following: a prototype; a model; a single, one-of-a-kind item; and, an item to be mass produced.

07B7C6A03722495EA97B436AFC253A54.description: Outline factors influencing selection of materials for production of goods (e.g., time for procurement, cost, suitability for the intended function, scale of production, appearance).

B4A8BB0193544294B63B92054E93ECD5.description: Explore the design relationship between available materials for production and the form of finished products.

5B1D124DECEF4A3AAFD175B79744B06C.description: Summarize the significance of accurate cost estimation to the industrial design proposal process.

A6E3AADFAAAB423CAF0315D359656CC9.description: Explain how development costs are recouped over a period of production for a variety of products.

09F423DAE46C4B8EBAA6C685C7A61805.description: Explore methods for calculating a total project material and process costs and determining the price for the project.

EB22678EED1E455EA15B3384E92443E9.description: Research a variety of methods of determining the cost of time and systems used in creating a project.

6B2A8CB6DA254AABA47301658B838BD9.description: Predict how the difference between small scale and large-scale manufacturing systems can affect the overall unit cost of a product

69887C80DF9B49E78556AE38E4520CEC.description: Explore how project flow and manufacturing systems impact the overall cost of production.

31A405EF14C64DCA93A02EC95FAFFAFB.description: Describe how a variety of manufacturing systems affects the cost of product development.

5CFB89967C224D55853508CAA631D04A.description: Analyze the relationship between quality and the cost of materials

8271F643887C471BA80FC5CA1397406F.description: Investigate how the costs of materials will affect the design of a product and how altering material choice will affect the overall cost

6557C8C3278B457086CEA66B3835E9E6.description: Define the following terms as they relate to the design industry: fixed costs; direct costs; indirect costs; and, material costs

E8D9C85D99C54B60A31324224A934B05.description: Assess the importance of estimating costs when developing an industrial design proposal.

8E8CC499ACD14BBA8CE28DCEA75609E9.description: Investigate the process of prototyping in industrial design, including: defining the purpose of the prototype; establishing the level of approximation required for the prototype; outlining an experimental plan; and, creating a schedule for procurement, construction and testing.

1833F63EABA44684921F168305EE28DF.description: Explore how technologies have impacted the development of rapid prototyping (e.g., computer assisted design, three-dimensional printing).

A3B629EF876740AD991CCA7B82EF0E17.description: Identify materials that are used in creating three-dimensional rapid prototypes.

ED214DB6A65E49E0AAEAB338885F7E04.description: Differentiate between sketching and modelling as an aspect of prototyping.

9869A91D353746BD92B63955248CFAC7.description: Explain how sketching is a type of rapid prototyping.

15B1C9731B41410CA9D61F3D67E959F7.description: Explore the role of rapid prototyping in industrial design.

51D82C7905B346C88CEE67587EC4F410.description: Produce a design solution that addresses an improvement to a given product.

158146061E0D42E8A76588076DED9D27.description: Identify an improvement to the industrial design of a given product.

8B8FFADA29E845679F1FB7F7F11C3E3C.description: Assess the quality of industrial design of a given product, according to: • usability; emotional appeal; ability to maintain and repair; efficient use of resources; and, product differentiation.

BD7891009CDA47F4B9C64348D6B0A13C.description: Describe the importance of industrial design in meeting aesthetic needs, including: visual product differentiation; pride of ownership, image and style; and, aesthetic appeal as motivator for a design team

232CCEC4BA8F4FD588D5280BBA2A98F3.description: Explain the following concepts associated with industrial design: innovation vs. continuous improvement; brand differentiation vs. product differentiation; functionality; aesthetics; integrity; ethics; durability; and, the safety of products.

D291B9AC9DE7430780036E9D04BCB315.description: Differentiate between industrial design and design of machines and systems for heavy industry.

601ABE40705E4AE5BAB072A9FB854357.description: Investigate the role of industrial design in meeting human needs.

E2DDA2BBAA1743FFB2A1B75978773E6B.description: Create a digital presentation of a design rendering.

C516DD1FD4FF4FB785FE7F18CA56AD99.description: Apply digital manipulation techniques to enhance a visual presentation (e.g., emboss, drop shadow).

64CD329E0BD54378819DBE401CA61816.description: Enhance presentations using techniques such as: transfer lettering; digital images; digital manipulations; raised areas; photographs; and collage.

0855E11746BF4A6AB752925727FAD458.description: Enhance drawings using media such as: markers; water colours; airbrushes; and, animation.

6CCA4FCD1A4043DCA241470E5839C835.description: Explain the purposes for rendering a design.

B1951DABC184490B9E89309E1080226C.description: Define the term rendering as it applies to design.

0A5E5CBD01F54415AE928399E855F44E.description: Use various techniques and media to make high quality design representations.

06411267E045475D8E8EEDC2B3328C1F.description: Explain how design factors such as elegance, timelessness, functionality and simplicity have been considered in the development of the threedimensional design.

E0664A7E107A46848D5A2CAEAB68F7F7.description: Describe alternative materials and processes that might be used for a product to improve: product quality; volume of production; cost per item; and, consumer interaction with the product

0C3F9426743E468FA51E9C9438B2BC30.description: Examine how changing aesthetics impacts the production process.

C13987D5FB0D48B19E21CEE686FDDE13.description: Describe the stages necessary to produce the product commercially.

32B94AC6010845E2A56237FC8CFE001B.description: Research the development history of a product and explore how changing the aesthetic characteristics impacts customer perception

58AD2CBDFCA740F5BFC6B648BEC2EDD9.description: Solve design problems using a variety of materials and processes.

0209C41B459A4FC8B5F64893D95BB1EB.description: Evaluate the relationship between function and aesthetics in threedimensional products.

07AE7CB6CAB440B585503E6AC6DDA294.description: Describe how aesthetic changes affect user interaction with a product.

3130C954E97D4A39A089BCBDE639F105.description: Construct various versions of a product exploring aesthetic changes.

3820850041974679BA68E65ABA89DCDC.description: Create a three-dimensional model of a proposed product.

28C8A2325D63431BAC6FC4667D28F439.description: Produce a design brief, including: selection of a problem of personal choice to be solved; identification of materials and fabrication processes; description of the stages of production; drawings; and, timelines for development.

B54A3EB998FD49FF8F27B2A6DA20748A.description: Identify various materials and processes that might be employed in producing an aesthetically pleasing product.

5E875DCE369B4DCA9D47A5758AABFA22.description: Describe how everyday products are designed to influence consumer choices (e.g., material choices influencing perceived value of product, use of colour in the finished product).

0D37E0CC265F4D359A15687B8EFA307A.description: Summarize the relationship between function and aesthetics.

6412BA7572974B4FBF3FA04E16E3FBA8.description: Outline time constraints that may exist in the production of a threedimensional product.

EA1876A07DFD41CEBDC57AA3BD2B89AF.description: Review feedback and incorporate ideas to improve a revised prototype.

CCD4E2853ED048D78AD60F5EAEB63193.description: Test the prototype collaboratively to solicit feedback from other design students and potential users of the product, with particular focus upon: functionality; aesthetics; elegance; timelessness; and, simplicity.

0518D2BB41A046F0AC3DB79BBFFB2906.description: Document the product development process, including: consideration of design elements (i.e., elegance, timelessness, simplicity); conflicting considerations such as balancing aesthetics and functionality; and, challenges best addressed via collaboration and critique.

DF3AF6E8F78A4BDDA81611EB5D07D4F7.description: Create a simple prototype of the three-dimensional product.

A8C8160C1F1442B5938841D3B08295FD.description: Identify potential materials and connectors for the three-dimensional product.

E511DBAE6CD74B6A85C432BFBF78E466.description: Produce digital or free-hand images illustrating the purpose of a new threedimensional product.

7168437F2EC64EDCA111F64CA7BD29A7.description: Identify the need for a new three-dimensional product.

F65789975F7444E39D6F893F1FC6C618.description: Research the developmental history of an existing simple product (i.e., no moving parts), focusing on design elements of elegance, timelessness, functionality and simplicity

2EA2E11C92804C86BA722556F17EB6FB.description: Review functionality, aesthetics, elegance, timelessness and simplicity as elements of design.

B7E3AB6296434CAE96D3310F4ACEBBA3.description: Create a simple threedimensional product using the design process.

1D7DE05375DA463C8393E38A71ECAF74.description: Articulate how changes have impacted the design elements of an existing design and the impact they will have on manufacturing an object.

4D6FBD39CF07473689C25759F9E3C3AC.description: Produce digital drawings of the initial design and the manipulated design.

63478B7DF6474AD89E1EB91376FE2FEF.description: Develop and implement a group critique process.

8C727BC86B704495A2DF462384570CAE.description: Demonstrate attention to detail and accuracy of measurement.

D21453781AB5499B9E629266C3F05214.description: Explore digital rights and open-source attribution to files that are manipulated.

098A1A4790954BB5BFF7A351D6DE923E.description: Design a plan for a new three-dimensional object from an existing design.

E5E425D178A442CFB5CBD10CBBD04DD9.description: Explore computer assisted design (CAD) tools for their purpose and function.

D3490C51E6A04EA992976918FE49CFFA.description: Create a threedimensional object design using computer assisted design.

E895D1FDEDC049169173960900674CFE.description: Invite critique of a design plan for an object developed from a pre-existing artifact.

3FB91FFED7C24673AD4CE38E44B967EC.description: Present a summary of research about an artifact inspiring design of a new object.

BEA8BB47FCC54DC494BCC9DAA2437FFF.description: Apply technical skills to produce a design plan for an object based on an artifact idea.

EB8DD91291B64235AED5B067E5D38EBB.description: Examine how the evolution of technology has allowed manufacturing systems to develop.

CA35A4D7C48241988C330B59053C3F38.description: Explore how having knowledge of a culture or time period helps understand reasons for design choices (e.g., why bricks are used instead of wood in some locations).

07637B842F594325A0C55D231B7310A6.description: Outline the steps of the design process reflected by the artifact.

1BDDBC5600F9411C94FCE38933D399B4.description: Describe the evolution of a designed artifact (e.g., churches, housing, furniture, clothing styles and fabrics) from a cultural perspective.

44D2BCA1D2584692873BACC86A2E738F.description: Research an artifact that represents Saskatchewan’s cultural heritage.

7E06916B3B044CD588B0C44BA0F61A1D.description: Differentiate between cultural appreciation and cultural appropriation.

8AA3631790A74500A7999E0D28008BF8.description: Articulate how an artifact is representative of a specific cultural and historic context.

FFE38F2E8DAC4EED81D96D42B37BF5C5.description: Determine how product design changes and evolves over time based on cultural contexts.

410B1D331DE04E28B9DD6996CF5118D9.description: Compare and contrast the design of products and spaces throughout the world and in different time periods.

B08E5C8694A94FC5B220406AA0C51EDA.description: Analyze how culture affects design of products and spaces, both past and present.

E0AE03CB7DCB4C959ACAF8D0C785AC15.description: Historical and Cultural Influences on Design (Core)
